column516: we created a list of marketing strategies that could get Daniel to his goal: Source Expected Sales Actual Sales Personal network + referrals 30 ??? Sale to Vancouver Rock Climbing Group 20 ??? Wholesale 50 ??? Marketplaces: eBay 25 ??? Giveaways 25 ??? Facebook ads 16 ??? Total 166 (his goal)"}

Search Google for “rock climbing Vancouver” or search “rock climbing” on Yelp. 2A. Go to websites listed and get the owner’s name (if possible)
column521: and phone number. OR 2B. Hire someone on Fiverr.com or Craigslist to go through every listing and add them on a sheet. And we messaged them
column523: {"title":"MILLION DOLLAR WEEKEND: THE SURPRISINGLY SIMPLE WAY TO LAUNCH A 7-FIGURE BUSINESS IN 48 HOURS"
column525: note:"Now let’s get a list of marketing strategies you can do. To do that you need to know: Who is your ideal customer? Where are they?"}

column528: note:"Who is your ideal customer? At Mint

column530: our customer is Marketing Agency Matt
column531: who is a solopreneur. At OkDork
column532: my customer is an underdog looking for inspiration on their business journey."}
column533: {"title":"MILLION DOLLAR WEEKEND: THE SURPRISINGLY SIMPLE WAY TO LAUNCH A 7-FIGURE BUSINESS IN 48 HOURS"
column535: note:"Now make a list of these places where we can find more of these people. For example
column536: with Daniel: Who: People who rock climb outdoors at least once a week. Where: North America/Canada
column538: purchase things from sporting goods stores
column540: are fans of Alex Honnold (the free soloist climber)
column541: are in meetups/online groups to talk about climbers
column542: watch specific YouTubers who teach new climbing techniques
column543: and eat energy food like CLIF Bars."}
column544: {"title":"MILLION DOLLAR WEEKEND: THE SURPRISINGLY SIMPLE WAY TO LAUNCH A 7-FIGURE BUSINESS IN 48 HOURS"
column546: note:"There’s a golden rule to marketing tactics I want you to repeat after me: Find what works and double down on it; find what doesn’t work and kill it."}
column547: {"title":"MILLION DOLLAR WEEKEND: THE SURPRISINGLY SIMPLE WAY TO LAUNCH A 7-FIGURE BUSINESS IN 48 HOURS"
column549: note:"This will help you think of ways you can overdeliver to your current customers. Because the biggest growth lever in business is customer retention and referrals. If you’re just starting out
column550: every referral can literally double your business."}
column551: {"title":"MILLION DOLLAR WEEKEND: THE SURPRISINGLY SIMPLE WAY TO LAUNCH A 7-FIGURE BUSINESS IN 48 HOURS"
column554: every step of the way you can get feedback to make your product or service even better. Ask your customers this: “What is one thing we can do today that will make you twice as happy with us?”"}
column555: {"title":"MILLION DOLLAR WEEKEND: THE SURPRISINGLY SIMPLE WAY TO LAUNCH A 7-FIGURE BUSINESS IN 48 HOURS"
column557: note:"Ask one customer: “What is one thing I can do today that will make you twice as happy with us?” TLDR of Growth In your MDW journal
column558: answer these five questions: What is your one goal for this year?   Who exactly is your customer and where can you find them?   What is one marketing activity you can double down on?   How can you delight your first 100 customers?   If you HAD to double your business with no money in thirty days
column560: {"title":"MILLION DOLLAR WEEKEND: THE SURPRISINGLY SIMPLE WAY TO LAUNCH A 7-FIGURE BUSINESS IN 48 HOURS"
column562: note:"You’re going to start by writing down how you’d love this year to turn out for you. This Dream Year isn’t just “I’m gonna have a nice house and my business will rock it.” Include the specifics—where you’re living
column566: etc. This is to inspire you about all the things you can do in your life. Then really dial in the ones that feel important to you. I’ve found it also helps me dream bigger: “Hot damn
column567: I can do all these inspiring things!”"}
column568: {"title":"MILLION DOLLAR WEEKEND: THE SURPRISINGLY SIMPLE WAY TO LAUNCH A 7-FIGURE BUSINESS IN 48 HOURS"
column570: note:"Now that you have created your Dream Year
column571: it’s time to take your dreams and choose and organize them into your goals. This is your life
column572: so PICK the things from your dream list you’re MOST excited about. Another key thing is consistency—it’s a GOOD thing if you’re continuing goals from previous years. Also
column573: I prefer to have fewer things to accomplish but I’m very excited to do them. Categorize them into four sections: Work
column577: {"title":"MILLION DOLLAR WEEKEND: THE SURPRISINGLY SIMPLE WAY TO LAUNCH A 7-FIGURE BUSINESS IN 48 HOURS"
column579: note:"The best way to make sure you accomplish your goals is to see them often. Here’s where I put mine. On the lock screen of my phone On a sticky on my computer On a text file that I look at each week On the mirror of my bathroom On a daily note that I read every day"}
column580: {"title":"MILLION DOLLAR WEEKEND: THE SURPRISINGLY SIMPLE WAY TO LAUNCH A 7-FIGURE BUSINESS IN 48 HOURS"
column582: note:"One hundred and sixty-eight. We all have the same number of hours in a week
column583: 168. How is it that some people get so much more done than others? With all the obligations like kids
column588: you must make sure to allocate time to things that matter. Show me YOUR calendar and I’ll tell you what’s most important to you. Since we’ve created your goals
column589: we now take those items and place them in your calendar every week. Here’s my calendaring system: Put everything in a Category. Assign a Color Code to your categories. Schedule with color your key weekly priorities. Perform a weekly Sunday accountability (p)review. I’m not telling you how to spend your time—instead
column590: I’m giving you the systems to make sure you’re allocating time toward your goals."}
column591: {"title":"MILLION DOLLAR WEEKEND: THE SURPRISINGLY SIMPLE WAY TO LAUNCH A 7-FIGURE BUSINESS IN 48 HOURS"
column593: note:"Category and Color Code Here’s a pretty typical screenshot of my calendar showing my weekly schedule:"}
column594: {"title":"MILLION DOLLAR WEEKEND: THE SURPRISINGLY SIMPLE WAY TO LAUNCH A 7-FIGURE BUSINESS IN 48 HOURS"
column596: note:"Blue = Work Green = Health Purple = Personal Yellow = Travel What color coding does is help me look at my calendar and instantly see: Am I spending my biggest blocks of time toward my goals? One glance gives me an immediate snapshot of the alignment of my work and priorities—and the mix of each day."}
column597: {"title":"MILLION DOLLAR WEEKEND: THE SURPRISINGLY SIMPLE WAY TO LAUNCH A 7-FIGURE BUSINESS IN 48 HOURS"
column599: note:"How do I pick what to actually do each week? Every Sunday
column600: I spend fifteen minutes looking over the past week and setting my tasks for the next one. This is your chance to revisit your yearly goals and choose activities each week to move you closer toward your goals. 2. How do I know if these tasks are moving me in the right direction of my goal? During my Sunday review I also take my previous Sunday’s goals and see how I did against them. This is my chance to evaluate if it moved the needle toward my yearly goal. It’s not to judge or shame yourself
column601: but to keep yourself accountable and continually improve. 3. What if I want to be lazy
column602: do I need to schedule it? WWND: What Would Neville Do? Hell no. There are days just like Neville’s when you want to do nothing. Enjoy it. Use your laziness to your advantage. Are there parts of your work you can outsource
column604: or find software to do for you (maybe at a great price on AppSumo.com!)? 4. How can I double down on activities that move me toward my goals? Whichever activities you love or help you with your goals
column605: put those on repeat. My motto: The more things that are on repeat
column606: the better. If every Monday and Thursday you do three hours of YouTube work starting at one p.m.
column607: it becomes habitual. And every Tuesday night I go biking; it’s automatic. If the important tasks are automatically added
column608: you free up your brain to focus on the more complex issues that give you energy and move you toward your goals. —"}
column609: {"title":"MILLION DOLLAR WEEKEND: THE SURPRISINGLY SIMPLE WAY TO LAUNCH A 7-FIGURE BUSINESS IN 48 HOURS"
column611: note:"That’s why every Sunday for the past ten years I’ve sent my friend Adam Gilbert my Sunday (P)review email outlining everything I said I’d do last week
column612: how much of it I accomplished
column613: and everything I want to do in the week ahead."}]
